com.yworks.yfiles.layout.tree

Class LeftRightNodePlacer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.tree.AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
      • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.tree.LeftRightNodePlacer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFromSketchNodePlacer, INodePlacer

    public class LeftRightNodePlacer
extends AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
    The LeftRightNodePlacer arranges the children in a subtree on the left and the right of a vertical bus.

    Layout Style

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.yworks.yfiles.layout.tree.AbstractRotatableNodePlacer

        AbstractRotatableNodePlacer.Matrix, AbstractRotatableNodePlacer.RootAlignment

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static NodeDpKey<Boolean> LEFT_RIGHT_DPKEY
      A DataProvider key for assigning nodes to the left or the right side of the bus If no IDataProvider is specified using this key, the nodes will be placed alternating from left to right.

    • Field Detail

      • LEFT_RIGHT_DPKEY

        public static final NodeDpKey<Boolean> LEFT_RIGHT_DPKEY
        A DataProvider key for assigning nodes to the left or the right side of the bus

        If no IDataProvider is specified using this key, the nodes will be placed alternating from left to right.

    • Method Detail

      • createComparator

        public Comparator<Object> createComparator()
        Returns a Comparator for outgoing edges that considers the locations of the target nodes.

        The Comparator applies the modification matrix of this LeftRightNodePlacer and then compares the y-coordinates of the target nodes.

        Overrides:
        createComparator in class AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
        Returns:
        the Comparator that compares outgoing edges according to the locations of their target nodes

      • createLeftRightDataProvider

        public static final IDataProvider createLeftRightDataProvider(IDataProvider nodePlacerMap)
        Creates a special IDataProvider that determines whether a given node is placed left or right of the parent node.

        This IDataProvider can be registered with the graph with key LEFT_RIGHT_DPKEY. It calculates the side with respect to the initial coordinates of the nodes in the graph, considering the orientation of the subtree.

        If a node is assigned to the left side, this IDataProvider will return true. For the right side, it will return false.

         
        LeftRightDataProvider provides a convenient way to determine the side of a node from the initial graph.
         
        Since the side of a node depends on the rotation of the associated INodePlacer, LeftRightDataProvider demands a IDataProvider containing the INodePlacer instances that are used for the layout calculation.
        Parameters:
        nodePlacerMap - a IDataProvider containing the corresponding INodePlacers for the node

      • determineChildConnector

        protected ParentConnectorDirection determineChildConnector(Node child)
        Determines a connector direction for the given child node.

        Since the connector directions are already determined by determineChildConnectors(Node, IDataMap), this method doesn't need to be called.

        Specified by:
        determineChildConnector in class AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called
        Parameters:
        child - the child node
        Returns:
        a direction specifier as defined in the INodePlacer interface

      • determineChildConnectors

        public void determineChildConnectors(Node localRoot,
                                     IDataMap connectorMap)
        Determines the direction of the child connectors according to which side of the bus the child is assigned.

        Children on the left will get a connector to the ParentConnectorDirection.EAST. Children on the right will get one to the ParentConnectorDirection.WEST. A connector to the ParentConnectorDirection.NORTH is assigned for the bottom child.

        Specified by:
        determineChildConnectors in interface INodePlacer
        Overrides:
        determineChildConnectors in class AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
        Parameters:
        localRoot - the local root node
        connectorMap - the map that must be used for storing the direction specifiers of the child nodes
        See Also:
        setLastOnBottomPlacementEnabled(boolean)

      • getHorizontalDistance

        public double getHorizontalDistance()
        Gets the horizontal distance between nodes or subtrees.

        The distance needs to be non-negative.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified distance is negative
        Default Value:
        The default value is 20.
        Returns:
        the non-negative horizontal distance
        See Also:
        setHorizontalDistance(double)

        public double getVerticalDistance()

        The distance needs to be non-negative.

        The default value is 20.
        Returns:

      • isLastOnBottomPlacementEnabled

        public boolean isLastOnBottomPlacementEnabled()
        Gets whether or not the last child is placed centered, aligned with the bus and below the other child nodes.

        When enabled, the last child will always be centered independent of the number of siblings.

        Default Value:
        The default value is true. The last child is centered below its siblings
        Returns:
        true if the last child is separated, false otherwise
        See Also:
        setLastOnBottomPlacementEnabled(boolean)

      • placeSubtree

                                           ParentConnectorDirection parentConnectorDirection)

        Specified by:
        placeSubtree in class AbstractRotatableNodePlacer
        Parameters:
        localRoot - the local root node
        parentConnectorDirection - the direction specifier for the connector of the local root node to its parent node
        Returns:
        the merged subtree shape that contains the local root node and all its children
